newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's forint ends lower vs dlr on mark loss.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's forint ends lower vs dlr on mark loss.

text.p: Hungary's forint closed easier against the dollar on the mark's losses in its cross with the US currency, but remained pinned to the central bank resistance level, or bid, dealers said on Wednesday.
"We followed the dollar/mark's movements," said Ervin Csengeri of Inter-Europa Bank.
The forint finished at 188.10/15 to the dollar, compared with 187.70/75 at the opening.
The NBH fixed the forint at 187.79 at midday, down from 187.52 on Tuesday.
The forint can drift below the NBH bid only marginally until the next monthly payments of import gas bills due at around June 20, dealers said.
The forint floats within the NBH's 4.5 percent intervention range, against a currency basket made up 30 percent of the dollar and 70 percent of the mark, .
